attributes.contentHtml:
God damn I havent used this website in awhile.
Dosent seem like it is completely dead but it definitely isnt as popular as it used to be.
I also feel like free Minecraft hosts have kinda died off. The only host that I know has even survived over the years is Falixnodes and I feel even it is way worse than it used to be in my short testing I did on their site.
Essentially, what happened to everyone/everything?

Hey everyone! This thread is for those who are new to hosting and want to set up their own server on an unknown 24/7 server hosting provider. First of all, let's check the IPs of your hosting provider to see which hosting they are using. Providers like Contabo and Azure often offer free trial nodes, so let's discuss what free trials are.

Free trials are like test runs for a limited period, usually ranging from 1 to 12 months, during which you can try out a hosting service without committing to a long-term payment plan. It's like checking out a demo of a website before you decide to buy or use it.

However, be cautious of hosting providers that frequently experience data loss either monthly or every 2 to 3 months. This could be a sign of scammers who abuse nodes and engage in illegal practices to obtain the hosting node. Unfortunately, I can't provide specific names, but be aware of common groups like rus.js, qlox, duck, and others who have been involved in such activities since 2021.

To ensure your data is safe and your hosting experience is smooth, it's best to use reputable and paid hosting services. While free trials might seem attractive, paid hosting offers more reliability and support, reducing the risk of data loss or other issues.

Stay safe and make informed choices when selecting a hosting provider. Remember, it's better to pay for quality service than to risk data loss and headaches with unreliable or suspicious hosts.

i do not want to write this, but just because how shit things are going i am required.
I am a Manager in SkyCastle, but because how shit everything is going i have to write the thread, just to warn people.
Everything was going well before nekaoumike joined the host. Since we used Jexactyl and we were running alot of issues using Jexactyl we decided to reset the host and use custom dash. Emerald offered to do it for 28$. They did hurry with the dash, released with not having tested the code (multible servers can be made, just spam the server create button, you can crash the dash with just keeping the field empty). We are using creative tim template for our template. Emerald told me his frontend is better but this is his frontend:
I asked the host owner why the fuck did they hurry but his answer was "i will lose ad spot if i dont have running host"

Also the host has no tos or pp site, atleast not listed somewhere.

These companies are selling under different names with same prices. They do not have a valid TOS or Privacy Policy, nor website. They are selling FXServers (Fivem) without authorization from the official provider nor developers.

They use Pterodactyl Panel (available @ https://client.teamnitro.shop/auth/login)

Overall:

I have notified both companies to let them know what has happened.

I decided to make a thread about this new hosting, because I think it's very suspicous.

First of all, they were reselling FalixNodes' servers many times (according to this thread: https://winterhoax.com/d/109-viahost) and now they decided to start a real minecraft hosting.

First thing that is suspicous that they don't pay anything at all for the nodes.
(According to the owner, the nodes are from a provider called "ArvanCloud")

Second thing that there is no TOS and Privacy Policies at all. Not even on the page, or on the discord.

Nothing on the main page btw, no information about the hosting.

Here are the hosting types that they provide
(when they opened there was an option called discord bot hosting but they removed that because they didn't find a ptero egg)

One thing to mention: my vanilla server with no plugins on this hosting took more than a minute to start lol "Can't keep up! Is the server overloaded? Running 5023ms or 100 ticks behind"

They give 6GB ram and 115% cpu core (they keep changing it so it might be different when you read this thread) for free, the #nodes channel in the discord has lack of information.

Great rules too:

The #information channel in Discord is fully empty:

Another thing to mention that the owner is 14

Personally I don't think that this hosting is ready for opening, website is not set up, discord is not set up, missing ptero eggs, slow nodes, etc.

I censored almost everyone's names. Some images have been provided by other people.

To skids and anyone else not involved: stfu don't reply to this thread if you're not part of it. I don't care if you know me in any way. if you aren't involved, don't reply.

Sydney owned this NSFW website: https://web.archive.org/web/20220923183155/https://bustybigtits.com/

One question: Can an owner of a Discord server ban/demote a staff JUST for doing their job?

NOTE: I AM JUST ASKING BECAUSE IT SEEMS WEIRD TO ME. I DON'T WANT THE DELAYED TURN TO COME NOW TO INSULT OR SOMETHING LIKE THAT. I'M JUST ASKING BECAUSE IT DOESN'T SQUARE ME. SO ANSWER ME IN A GOOD WAY

I am a staff of a Discord server. And they gave me a warn for doing my job. Look at these.


Rules for staffs:
DO NOT CREATE CHANNELS WITHOUT PERMISSION
This seems logical to me, because the server has a structure and if channels started to be created it would be chaos.

DO NOT CREATE THREADS. ADD REACTIONS, OR SEND MESSAGES IN #WELCOME

I can understand this about the messages, but the threads or reactions do NOT make sense.

DO NOT WRITE TO (x channels)
UNLESS THE FOUNDER GIVES YOU PERMISSION

Same as before, I get it.

DO NOT ADD ROLES.

This is indeed incredible. I mean, you can't create roles, when your role system is a dogshit?

Well, each owner decides the rules, but I see that server with a lot of potential, but the lack of competition from the owner is ruining it.

Well, read this for yourselves.

damn, what a fucking kid

Graitexity (Clxudd), has been caught red-handed trying to steal artwork from one of our dear friends. And for what, you may ask? Well, apparently this shady character wanted to remove our friend's watermark and claim the artwork as his own.

But the drama doesn't end there, folks. Oh no, it gets even juicier. It turns out that this same Graitexity (Clxudd) is now running some kind of scam associated with the Donut SMP Minecraft server. Can you believe the audacity of this guy?

We strongly advise everyone to steer clear of this Graitexity (Clxudd). We're talking some seriously shady business going on here, folks. So if you want to avoid being caught up in the drama, be sure to stay far away from this individual and any schemes he may be running. Trust us, it's not worth the risk.
